intro: Phaeocarpus campestris, commonly known as the field phaeocarpus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically oval with a smooth texture and a reddish tint on the underside. Phaeocarpus campestris is often found in moist, open habitats such as fields and along stream banks.
